flawed_nl_solution:
There were 30 + 20 = <<30+20=70>>70 attendees at the party.
A total of 70 x 2/5 = <<70*2/5=28>>28 people left the party.
Nine of those who left were men while 28 - 9 = <<28-9=19>>19 of them were women.
So, 30 - 19= <<30-19=11>>11 women stayed at the party.
And 20 - 9 = <<20-9=11>>11 men stayed at the party.
Thus, 11 - 11 = <<11-11=0>>0 more women than men stayed at the party.
#### 0

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 50, not 70. It appears there was a miscalculation with the digits before the final zero.
